name: Loblaw Pharmacy
address: Loblaw Pharmacy, 333 Seymour Blvd, North Vancouver, BC V7J 2J4

featured_reviews.review_id:
No customer service. Long waits for them to glue a sticker to a tube. No advice, checks for allergies or whatnot. Told me to check with my doctor for instructions on how to use the medication. Ignored my ask to fill in only one of the items, instead filled both refills and charged me $10 dispensing fee for all items. There are 4 persons behind the counter, but 2 of them are playing on computers rather than helping lining customers.

Had to use them again because my new pharmacist is closed today, they refused to fill in the medication by phone and asked to come by instead.

featured_reviews.review_id: I have consistently poor experiences with this pharmacy. Customers often wait while people work with their heads down not acknowledging anyone, even to say they'll be with them in a minute.  I've have multiple issues getting prescriptions being told they don't have my prescription until I push to have them look into it and it turns out they do. A few times I've refilled my prescription ahead of time only to arrive and find it's not ready or the medication is not available, yet no one bothered to contact me. One time I was told to return in 45 min which I did after waking around the store to be told my medication wasn't in stock yet no one bothered to call me. I'm not sure how this pharmacy stays in business

featured_reviews.review_id: We shop at the North Vancouver superstore quite a bit and always get good service, however, I can't say the same about their pharmacy. If I could give them  -1 star I would, and that's why I try to avoid going to that pharmacy as much as possible.  Unfortunately, this time it was an emergency and I had to go to the nearest one asap. I was promised 40 minutes, but after 40 minutes, I was told that I have to wait another 15, then another 10 minutes. Finally after almost an hour and a half I got my medication, but at this point the pharmacist noticed that I am allergic to penicillin and the capsules I got belong to the penicillin group of medication, in spite of that she sold it to me and advised that I just take Benadryl if I feel sick. I called my doctor and explained the situation, he said that I absolutely shouldn't experiment and see if I get sick or not. He called the pharmacy and changed the prescription.  I had to wait another hour for the new prescription to be ready (of course they didn't take back the first one), but the best part was when my wife told them that their service is poor she got the answer, "then don't come here". We certainly will take their advice and NEVER shop there again.

featured_reviews.review_id: This pharmacy stuff is very rude, unprofessional unpolite, I do not recommend people came here for people to come here. The stuff is really really bad.
featured_reviews.review_text: This pharmacy stuff is very rude, unprofessional unpolite, I do not recommend people came here for people to come here. The stuff is really really bad.

featured_reviews.review_id: The woman who gave me my flu vaccine was very rude.  She did not double check my name, birthday, or the right vaccine. She did not tell me to stay around 15 min or confirm allergies. I didn't want a bandaid because I react to the glue and she kept insisting it wasn't latex which was irrelevant, but somehow she thought l was confused and didn't want one because I thought it was latex, which it's not, which I knew, which I said (and yes I understand the very low risk of infection).  My biggest concern was the lack of pre-administration safety checks and post-vaccine instructions to stay around.  The women behind the counter were friendly and helpful.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My family has 10+ years of experience getting prescriptions filled at this pharmacy.  In the years I been there, at least 5 or 6 different crews of people have served me, which means this pharmacy has a hard time hanging on to staff.

On more than one occasion I was dispensed the correct medication, but it was dispensed to me under the wrong Physician prescriber name!!  Even after both my physician and I pointed this out to the pharmacist manager, it happened again.

The main problem at this pharmacy is poor customer service. A lot of the problems at the North Vancouver Superstore Pharmacy can be placed squarely on the shoulders of the management team. Putting consumer needs first, need to be a key element of the workplace culture. Without good customer service, who one cares if this store can get the right pills in a container (any pharmacy can do this).

Pharmacy improvements could include: improvements to workplace culture thereby improving the satisfaction of the workers which in turn trickles down to the customers, friendliness, having Rxs ready when the pharmacy say they will be ready, fulling Rxs faxed in by physicians offices, calling customer/doctor to clarify (instead of waiting until the customer shows up) thereby forcing the customer to wait another 30 mins, calling the customer when the Prescription cant be filled.

I've moved my family to a much better pharmacy where we get much better care.

featured_reviews.review_id:
The worst pharmacy with the staff changing every few Months.
Me and my husband are with them 10 years but is going down and down.
No food customer service,rudnese of the stuff no control who is doing and what.
Only a few of them Asian staff are very good and helpful respectfull and really know what they are doing.Rest are like garbage.Who hire them ever!!!!
Ignoring customers and don't understand what I am looking for and where to look to finder out if fax is arrived or no .Very under knowledgeable with NO proper school or what?
Redicilous

featured_reviews.review_id: Michael has always been friendly, competent and efficient. Everyone else we've dealt with is utterly uncaring and useless. We are looking for another pharmacy, because the convenience of picking up a prescription while we're shopping is completely outweighed by the long wait times, apathetic attitude of the staff, and having to make multiple return trips for every prescription.
